Birth Certificates
Last updated 11/5/2025.
Request a birth certificate for anyone born in San Diego County.
 Here’s how:
For those born within the last 2 years
, contact the Office of
 Vital Records and Statistics (OVRS) at (619) 692-5733 or see
 below.
Steps to request a birth certificate
in-person
,
online
, or
by
 mail
.
Birth certificates cannot be sent by email
 or fax.
Register
 an Out of Hospital Birth
.
For those born more than 2 years ago
, contact the
San
 Diego County Clerk
.
Types of birth certificates:
Authorized Certified Copy – only given to
authorized
 Individuals
with a notarized Sworn Statement.
Informational Certified Copy – given to all other individuals. A
 Sworn Statement is not needed.
A certified copy of a birth certificate costs $32.00
. This fee
 is set by the State.
Fee Waivers for Persons Experiencing Homelessness or Foster
 Youth
By
law
,
 each live birth in San Diego must be registered with OVRS within 21
 days of the child's birth. See
Frequently
 Asked Questions
for more information.
Request A Birth Certificate
In-Person
1.
OVRS is open Monday through Friday 9:00 am – 5:00 pm.
We are located at:
5530
 Overland Avenue, Suite 170,
San
 Diego, CA 92123
2.
Be ready to complete an application and provide the
 following information:
Child's full name as it listed on the birth certificate,
Mother's full maiden name,
Child's date of birth,
 and
A valid government issued picture ID.
3.
A payment of $32.00 per copy is required. Pay by:
Cash,
Debit, credit, tap to pay, or
Check or
 money order, payable to
County of San Diego
.
Top of Page
Online
VitalChek
is
 a third-party website that processes Certificate requests online for OVRS.
1.
Visit
VitalChek.com
.
2.
Go to "Order Certificate", then choose "Birth Certificates."
3.
Fill out the application.
4.
Complete payment with credit card, debit card, or electronic check.
Certificate fee is $32.00 per copy.
VitalChek
 processing fee is $12.95.
Shipping fee is no cost for
 regular mail, or $19.00 for Express UPS.
For
 more information, visit VitalChek
online
, or
 call 1-877-459-1061.
Top of Page
Mail
1.
Fill out the
Application
 for a Birth Certificate
.
2.
Provide a payment of $32.00 per copy with a completed check
 or money order, payable to
County of San Diego
.
Cash is
NOT
accepted.
3.
Mail completed Application for a Birth Certificate and
 payment to:
County of San Diego Vital Records
5530 Overland Avenue,
 Suite 170
San Diego, CA 92123
Top of Page
Register an Out of Hospital Birth
If your baby was born outside of a hospital, such as at a birthing
 center, at home, or another location this is considered an
Out
 of Hospital Birth
.
If a Licensed Midwife Was Present
The midwife is
responsible
for registering the birth within 21 days.
To register a
 birth, email
homebirth.hhsa@sdcounty.ca.gov
.
If No Midwife or Doctor was Present (Unattended Birth)
The parents must register the birth.
This process is
 done by
appointment only,
 after the baby is born
.
Please bring proof to your
 appointment to show these five things:
Who the parent or
 parents are,
That the person gave birth and was
 pregnant,
That the baby was born alive,
That
 the birth happened in California, and
Who the
 witness is (if there was one).
Contact us at (619) 692-5733, or send an email to
homebirth.hhsa@sdcounty.ca.gov
,
 for more information or to begin the registration process.
Top of Page
Fee Waivers
Per Assembly Bills
1733/2490
and
2967
,
 the following can get a copy of a birth record without a fee:
A person experiencing homelessness, or a child or youth
 experiencing homelessness.
Youth in foster care.
Requests can be made by visiting our office at
5530
 Overland Avenue, Suite 170, San Diego, CA 92123
. Applicants must
 fulfill the requirements listed in the:
Affidavit
 of Homeless Status for Fee Exempt Certified Copy of Birth
 Certificate
, or
Affidavit of Youth in Foster Care Status for Fee Exempt
 Certified Copy of Birth Certificate
.
Top of Page
Call the Office of Vital Records at (619) 692-5733, or send
 an
email
, for
 more information.
